Provision.Text: Whereas the Governor in Council is of the opinion that the situation in Iran constitutes a grave breach of international peace and security that has resulted or is likely to result in a serious international crisis;

Therefore, Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Foreign Affairs, pursuant to subsections 4(1) to (3) of the Special Economic Measures Acta, hereby makes the annexed Special Economic Measures (Iran) Regulations.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Canadian financial institution has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Bank Act. (institution financière canadienne)
Convention means the Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations, done at Vienna on April 18, 1961. (Convention)
Guide has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Export Control List. (Guide)
Iran means the Islamic Republic of Iran and includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any of its political subdivisions;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its government and any of its departments or a government or department of its political subdivisions; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any of its agencies or any agency of its political subdivisions. (Iran)

Definition.Text: Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action means the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (S/2015/544) prepared jointly by China, France, Germany, the Russian Federation, the United Kingdom and the United States, with the High Representative of the European Union for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy, and Iran, on July 14, 2015 and endorsed by the Security Council of the United Nations in Resolution 2231 (2015) of July 20, 2015. (Plan d’action global commun)
Minister means the Minister of Foreign Affairs. (ministre)
mission premises has the same meaning as “premises of the mission” in Article 1 of the Convention, and includes the mission’s archives. (locaux de la mission)

pension means a benefit paid under the Old Age Security Act, the Canada Pension Plan or an Act respecting the Quebec Pension Plan, R.S.Q. c. R-9, any superannuation, pension or benefit paid under or in respect of any retirement savings plan or under any retirement plan, any amount paid under or in respect of the Garnishment, Attachment and Pension Diversion Act or the Pension Benefits Division Act, and any other payment made in respect of disability. (pension)

Section.Text: A person whose name is listed in Schedule 1 is a person in respect of whom the Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister, is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds to believe is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person who has engaged in activities that directly or indirectly facilitate, support, provide funding for, contribute to, or could contribute to

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Iran’s activities related to the development of chemical, biological or nuclear weapons of mass destruction or delivery systems for such weapons, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: activities that undermine international peace, security or stability in a manner that is consistent with the policies of Iran;

Paragraph.Label: (a.01)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a person referred to in paragraph (a) that is an entity, a senior official of the entity;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: a person who has participated in gross and systematic human rights violations in Iran;

Paragraph.Label: (a.2)
Paragraph.Text: a former or current senior official of the Government of Iran;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a former or current senior official in the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an associate of a person referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (b);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a family member of a person referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (c) and (f);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an entity owned — or held or controlled, directly or indirectly — by a person referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (d); or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a senior official of an entity referred to in paragraph (e).

Section.Text: It is prohibited for any person in Canada or any Canadian outside Canada to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: deal in any property, wherever situated, that is owned — or that is held or controlled, directly or indirectly — by a listed person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: enter into or facilitate any transaction related to a dealing referred to in paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: provide any financial or related service in respect of a dealing referred to in paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: make any goods, wherever situated, available to a listed person or to a person acting on behalf of a listed person; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: provide any financial or related service to a listed person or to a person acting for the benefit of a listed person.

Section.Text: Section 3 does not apply with respect to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pension payments to any person in Canada or any Canadian outside Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any transaction in respect of any account held by a diplomatic mission at a financial institution, if the transaction is required in order for the mission to fulfil its diplomatic functions as set out in Article 3 of the Convention or, if the diplomatic mission has been temporarily or permanently recalled, if the transaction is required in order to maintain the mission premises;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any transaction with any international organizations with diplomatic status, with any United Nations agencies, with the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement, or with any Canadian non-governmental organizations that have entered into a grant or contribution agreement with the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the transfer of any accounts, funds or investments held on behalf of a Canadian by a listed person on the day on which that person’s name was listed to any person who is not a listed person;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any dealings with respect to loan repayments made by a listed person on loans entered into before the day on which that person’s name was listed to any person in Canada or any Canadian outside Canada who is not a listed person;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the exercise of a right by a person who is not a listed person with respect to a listed person’s property that is subject to a lien, mortgage or security interest, to a hypothec or prior claim, to a charge or to a judicial, administrative or arbitral decision;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: financial services required in order for a listed person to obtain legal services in Canada with respect to the application of any of the prohibitions set out in these Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: property that is necessary for the civil nuclear cooperation projects described in Annex III to the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action or for any activity required for the implementation of that Plan.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: arms and related material means any type of weapon, ammunition, military equipment — including military vehicles — or paramilitary equipment, and their spare parts. (armes et matériel connexe)
technical assistance means any form of assistance, such as providing instruction, training, consulting services or technical advice. (aide technique)

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited for any person in Canada or any Canadian outside Canada to export, sell, supply or ship any of the goods listed in Schedule 2, wherever situated, to Iran, to a person in Iran, or to a person for the purposes of a business carried on in or operated from Iran.
It is prohibited for any person in Canada or any Canadian outside Canada to transfer, provide or disclose to Iran or any person in Iran any technical data related to the goods listed in Schedule 2.

It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to export, sell, supply or ship any of the following goods, wherever situated, or to provide any of the following technical assistance or technical data, to Iran or to any person in Iran:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: those that are listed in the following provisions of the Guide:

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any battle tanks, armoured combat vehicles, large-calibre artillery systems, combat aircraft, attack helicopters, warships, missiles or missile systems as defined for the purposes of the Register of Conventional Arms, established by Resolution 46/36 L adopted by the United Nations General Assembly on December 9, 1991, as amended from time to time, or related material including their spare parts;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: those that appear in document S/2015/546 of the Security Council of the United Nations, entitled Missile Technology Control Regime: Equipment, Software and Technology Annex, which is an annex to the letter dated July 16, 2015 from the Permanent Representative of the United States of America to the United Nations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any technical assistance or technical data in respect of any activity related to ballistic missiles capable of delivering nuclear weapons, including launches using ballistic missile technology, or related to the development of nuclear weapon delivery systems, that is inconsistent with the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action.

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to provide any property, technical assistance or financial or related services to Iran or to any person in Iran related to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the exportation, sale, supply or shipment of any of the goods referred to in subsection (3);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacture or use of such a good in Iran or on behalf of Iran; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the provision of technical assistance or technical data referred to in subsection (3).

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to import, purchase or acquire arms and related material from Iran or from any person in Iran.
It is prohibited for any person in Canada, and any Canadian outside Canada, who is an owner or master of a ship or an operator of an aircraft to ship

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any of the goods referred to in paragraph (3)(c) from Iran; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: arms and related material, wherever situated, to any person in Canada who acquired them from Iran or from any person in Iran.

Section.Text: It is prohibited for any person in Canada or any Canadian outside Canada to knowingly do anything that causes, facilitates or assists in, or is intended to cause, facilitate or assist in, any activity prohibited by sections 3 and 4.
Sections 4 and 8 do not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: equipment, services and software that facilitate secure and widespread communications via information technologies, or the provision or acquisition of financial services in relation to such equipment, services and software, provided that an export permit has been issued in respect of any goods listed in the Guide;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: goods used to purify water for civilian and public health purposes, or the provision or acquisition of financial services in relation to such goods; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any activity, or the provision or acquisition of financial services in relation to an activity, that has as its purpose

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the provision of food, medicine and medical supplies.

Section.Text: The following entities must determine on a continuing basis whether they are in possession or control of property that is owned — or that is held or controlled, directly or indirectly — by a listed person:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: authorized foreign banks, as defined in section 2 of the Bank Act, in respect of their business in Canada, and banks regulated by that Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cooperative credit societies, savings and credit unions and caisses populaires regulated by a provincial Act and associations regulated by the Cooperative Credit Associations Act;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: foreign companies, as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Insurance Companies Act, in respect of their insurance business in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: companies, provincial companies and societies, as those terms are defined in subsection 2(1) of the Insurance Companies Act;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: fraternal benefit societies regulated by a provincial Act in respect of their insurance activities and insurance companies and other entities regulated by a provincial Act that are engaged in the business of insuring risks;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: companies regulated by the Trust and Loan Companies Act;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: trust companies regulated by a provincial Act;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: loan companies regulated by a provincial Act;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: entities that engage in any business described in paragraph 5(h) of the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act if the business involves the opening of an account for a client; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: entities authorized under provincial legislation to engage in the business of dealing in securities or to provide portfolio management or investment counselling services.

Subsection.Text: Every person in Canada, every Canadian outside Canada and every entity set out in section 9 must disclose without delay to the Commissioner of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police or to the Director of the Canadian Security Intelligence Service

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the existence of property in their possession or control that they have reason to believe is owned — or held or controlled, directly or indirectly — by a listed person; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any information about a transaction or proposed transaction in respect of property referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: No proceedings under the Special Economic Measures Act and no civil proceedings lie against a person for a disclosure made in good faith under subsection (1).
A listed person may apply to the Minister in writing to have their name removed from Schedule 1.
On receipt of an application, the Minister must decide whether there are reasonable grounds to recommend to the Governor in Council that the applicant’s name be removed from Schedule 1.

Section.Text: If there has been a material change in circumstances since the last application was submitted under section 11, a person may submit another application.

Subsection.Text: A person whose name is the same as or similar to the name of a listed person and who claims not to be that person may apply to the Minister in writing for a certificate stating that they are not that listed person.
Within 30 days after receiving the application, the Minister must,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if it is established that the applicant is not the listed person, issue the certificate; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it is not so established, provide notice to the applicant of his or her determination.

Section.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 11(2)(a) of the Statutory Instruments Act, these Regulations apply before they are published in the Canada Gazette.
These Regulations come into force on the day on which they are registered.

Heading.Label: PART 1
Heading.TitleText: Entities — Grave Breach of International Peace and Security

Item.Text: Defence Industries Organization Training and Research Institute
Designing, Engineering & Manufacturing Development of Iran Khodro Co. (DEMICO) Heavy Metal Industries (HMI)
Everend Asia Co. Machines & Indus. Services

Iran Aircraft Manufacturing Industries (also known as IAMI, IAMCO, HESA, HASA, Iran Aircraft Manufacturing Company, Iran Aircraft Mfg. In. Co., Iran Aircraft Manufacturing Industries Corporation, Havapeyma Sazhran, Hava Payma Sazi-E Iran, Havapeyma Sazi Iran, HESA Trade Center and Karkhanejate Sanaye Havapaymaie Iran)
Iranian Committee for the Reconstruction of Lebanon
Iranian Research Organization for Science and Technology (IROST)
IRGC Air Force (and IRGC Air Force Missile Command)
Islamic Republic of Iran Air Force
Mavadkaran Jahed Noavar Co. (also known as Mavad Karan and Mavad Karan Jahad-e-No’avar)
Ministry of Defence Armed Forces Logistics (MODAFL)
Parashnoor Photonics Co. (also known as Parashnoor Laser & Electro-Optic Co.)
Razi Vaccine and Serum Research Institute in the Ministry of Jahad
SANAM Electronics Co. (Shahid Shahabady Industrial Complex)
Shahid Beheshti University, Department of Engineering
Turbine Blade Engineering and Manufacturing Co. (PARTO)
Arfa Paint Company (also known as Arfeh Company)
Ashtian Tablo (also known as Bals Alman)
ESNICO (Equipment Supplier for Nuclear Industries Corporation)
Paya Partov (also known as Paya Parto)
Sepanir Oil and Gas Energy Engineering Company
South Way Shipping Agency Company Limited
Taghtiran (also known as Taghtiran Kashan Company)
Technology Cooperation Office (TCO) of the Iranian President’s Office
Turbine Engineering and Manufacturing (TEM) (also known as TEM Co.)
Basij-e Mostazafan (also known as Sazman-e Basij-e Mostazafan and the Basij)
Iran Pooya (also known as Iran Pouya)
Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (also known as IRGC, Army of the Guardians of the Islamic Revolution, Iranian Revolutionary Guards, IRG and Sepah-e Pasdaran-e Enghelab-e Eslami)
Mandegar Baspar Asia (also known as Mandegar Baspar Fajr Asia)
Sharif University of Technology, Department of Engineering
The Iranian Institute for Composite Materials

Baghyatollah Medical Sciences University (BMSU) (also known as Bagiatollah Medical Sciences University, Baghiatollah Medical Sciences University, Baqyatollah Medical Sciences University, Baqiyatallah Medical Sciences University, Baqiyatallah University of Medical Sciences and Baqiatollah Medical Sciences University)
Explosion and Impact Technology Research Centre
Mowj Nasr Gostar Communications and Electronics Company
Pars Amayesh Sanaat Kish (also known as PASK, Vacuumkaran, Vacuum Karan and Vacuum Karan Co.)
Pishro Systems Research Company (also known as Pishro Company, Advanced Systems Research Company, ASRC, Center for Advanced Systems Research and CRAS)
Samen AlAiemeh Credit Cooperative (also known as Samen Credit Cooperative)
Tehran Gostaresh Company (also known as Tehran Gostaresh Co. PJS)
Paravar Pars Aerospace Engineering Services and Research Company (also known as Paravar Pars Company)
Design and Manufacturing of Aircraft Engines Company (DAMA)
Javan News Agency (also known as Javan)
Ministry of Defence Logistics and Export (MODLEX)
The Naval Defence Missile Industry Group
Defence Technology and Science Research Centre (DTSRC)
Kavan Electronics Behrad Limited Liability Company
Basamad Electronic Pouya Engineering Limited Liability Company (also known as Dynamic Electronic Frequency Engineering Limited Liability Company)
The Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps’ (IRGC) Cyber Defense Command
Office of the Enjoining Right and Forbidding Evil

Heading.Label: PART 2
Heading.TitleText: Individuals — Grave Breach of International Peace and Security

Item.Text: Hojatoleslam Ali Saidi (also known as Hojjat-al-Eslam Ali Saidi and Hojjat-al-Eslam Ali Saeedi)
Amir Ali Haji Zadeh (also known as Amir Ali Hajizadeh)
Saeed Aghajani (also known as Hamid Aghajani)
Seyyed Yahya Safavi (born in 1952) (also known as Rahim Safavi)
Seyyed Mohammed Saleh Hashemi Golpayegani (born in 1967)
Seyed Ali Asghar Mir Hejazi (born in 1946)
Seyed Saied Reza Ameli Renani (born in 1961)
Masoud Dorosti (also known as Masood Darshti and Masood Dorosti)
Siamak Rahpeik (born in 1963 or 1964) (also known as Siyamak Rahpeyk, Siamak Rahpiek and Siyamak Rah-Peyk)

row.entry: Any equipment designed to measure in real time the aerodynamic particle size of aerosols in the range of 0.1 to 50 micrometers.
Any equipment capable of producing aerosols of radioactive, chemical or biological materials with aerodynamic particle sizes in the range of 0.1 to 50 micrometres.

Piping, tubing, fittings, flanges, forging, castings, valves, any unfinished products in any form and any waste or scrap that are made of aluminum and its alloys that are not specified in the Export Control List.
Argon ion lasers that are not specified in the Export Control List and have an average output power equal to or greater than 5 W.
Double-ended or pass-through autoclaves with internal volume greater than 1 m3, bioseal, interlocking doors, warning lights or audible alarms.
Systems that are usable in the systems specified in entry 6-1.A.2 of the Guide and are capable of operating vehicles with a stall speed in excess of 30 knots.
Batch centrifuges with a rotor capacity of 25 L or greater, usable with biological material.
Bellows-sealed scroll compressors and vacuum pumps

Provision.Text: The following vacuum pumps:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: turbomolecular pumps having a flow-rate equal to or greater than 400 l/s;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: Roots-type roughing pumps having a volumetric aspiration flow-rate greater than 200 m³/hr;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: bellows-sealed, scroll, dry pumps; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: bellows-sealed, scroll, dry compressor pumps.
Vacuum pumps that are not specified in the Export Control List and that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: are suitable for corrosive fluids;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: have a maximum flow-rate greater than 5 m³/hr, measured under standard temperature and pressure conditions of 273 K (0°C) and 101.3 kPa, respectively; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: are pumps in which all surfaces that may come into direct contact with fluids consist of stainless steel, aluminium alloy or a combination of the two.

row.entry: Mechanical equipment designed or usable for decanning or decladding spent nuclear reactor fuel as part of a fuel processing process.
Any drum drying equipment capable of producing dry particles of radioactive, chemical or biological materials with aerodynamic particle sizes in the range of 0.1 to 50 micrometres.
Electrical power supply units and transformers

Provision.Text: High voltage direct current power supply units that are not specified in the Export Control List and

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: are capable of continuously producing 10 kV or more over a period of 8 hours, with output power of 5 kW or more with or without sweeping; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: have current or voltage stability better than 0.1% over a period of 4 hours.
Electrolytic cells that are not specified in the Export Control List that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: are used for fluorine production; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: have an output capacity greater than 100 g of fluorine per hour.
The following fibrous or filamentary materials or prepregs that are not specified in the Export Control List:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: carbon or aramid fibrous or filamentary materials having either

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: a specific modulus exceeding 10 x 10^6 m, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: a specific tensile strength exceeding 17 x 10^4 m;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: glass fibrous or filamentary materials having either

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: a specific modulus exceeding 3.18 x 10^6 m, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: a specific tensile strength exceeding 76.2 x 10^3 m; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: thermoset resin-impregnated continuous yarns, rovings, tows and tapes with a width of 15 mm or less (prepregs), made for carbon or glass fibrous or filamentary materials.
Flow-forming machines and spin-forming machines capable of flow-forming functions and mandrels, as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: machines that have three or more rollers and that can be equipped with numerical control units or a computer control; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: rotor-forming mandrels designed to form cylindrical rotors with an inside diameter between 75 and 400 mm.

row.entry: Frequency changers (inverters) and specially designed software for them

Provision.Text: Frequency changers that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: have multiphase frequency output;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: are capable of providing power of 40 W or greater;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: are capable of operating anywhere between 600 and 2000 Hz; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: have frequency control less than 0.2%.
Specially designed software for these frequency changers.

row.entry: Any glove boxes or similar devices with remote manipulators that can provide the operator with protection from radiation or radioactive materials.
Controlled-atmosphere heat treatment furnaces capable of operation at temperatures above 400°C.
HEPA filters of a frame area of 0.0625 m2 or larger with a DOP rating of 99.997% (at 0.3 micron) or higher.
Electronic framing cameras having a speed exceeding 1000 frames per second.
Must be suitable for use in shielding.
Magnetic alloys in thin strip form
Magnetic alloy materials in sheet or thin strip form with a thickness of 0.1 mm or less, made of iron-chromium-cobalt, iron-cobalt-vanadium, iron-chromium-cobalt-vanadium or iron-chromium.

Provision.Text: The following mass spectrometers that are not specified in the Export Control List that are capable of measuring ions of 200 atomic mass units or more and have a resolution of better than 2 parts in 200:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometers (ICP/MS);

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: glow discharge mass spectrometers (GDMS);

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: thermal ionization mass spectrometers (TIMS);

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: electron bombardment mass spectrometers with a source chamber constructed from, lined with or plated with, materials resistant to corrosion by UF6;

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: molecular beam mass spectrometers with either

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: a source chamber constructed from, lined with or plated with, stainless steel or molybdenum and equipped with a cold trap capable of cooling to 193 K (-80°C) or less, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: a source chamber constructed from, lined with or plated with, materials resistant to corrosion by UF6; and

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: mass spectrometers equipped with a microfluorination ion source usable with actinides or actinide fluorides.

row.entry: Any device designed to produce oligonucleotides from nucleic acids or derivatives.
Furnaces capable of operation at temperatures over 400°C.

Riot helmets and associated equipment, balaclavas, flashbangs, sting-ball grenades, impact munitions, chemical munitions, clothing specifically used for physical protection in riot control situations, batons and paintball guns.
Sintered metal filters employing monel or other high nickel content alloys

Provision.Text: Sintered metal filters made of

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: nickel; or

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: nickel alloy with a nickel content of 40% or more by weight.

row.entry: Sintering systems, including parts, software and technology for them, capable of generating a temperature in excess of 999°C or atmospheric pressure of less than 2 atmospheres.
Absolute pressure transducers capable of measuring absolute pressures below 100 kPa, and specially designed parts and software for them.
Gamma-ray spectrometers of all types and specifications, and specially designed parts and software for them.
Numerically controlled machine tools of all types, and specially designed parts and software for them.
Electroslag remelters of all types and specifications, and specially designed parts for them.
Gold, silver, platinum, palladium, ruthenium, rhodium, osmium and iridium
In addition to specific items made of those metals referred to in these Regulations, all raw, semi-finished or finished forms of those metals or their alloys.
Helium or hydrogen leak detectors capable of detecting leak rates of less than 1 x 10-5 standard cubic centimetres of air per second (atm cc/s for air).
Any smelting machines and specially designed parts for them, as well as any reducing agents or fluxes used in the smelting process.
Stainless steel valves, piping, tubing and fittings
Any valves, piping, tubing and fittings that are made of stainless steel type 304, 316 or 317 and that are not specified in the Export Control List.

Maraging steels in the Export Control List 6-6.C.8 having an ultimate tensile strength equal to or greater than 2.05 GPa, measured at 20°C, in the form of sheet, plate or tubing with a wall or plate thickness equal to or less than 5.0 mm and usable in systems specified in 6-1.A or 6-19.A.1 of the Guide.

Provision.Text: Propellants and constituent chemicals for propellants, either as a pure substance or as a mixture containing at least 50% of one of the following chemicals:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: toluene diisocyanate (TDI);

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: methyl diphenyl diisocyanate (MDI);

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: isophorone diisocyanate (IPDI);

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: sodium perchlorate;

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: xylidine;

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: hydroxy terminated polyether (HTPE); or

Provision.Label: (g)
Provision.Text: hydroxy terminated caprolactone ether (HTCE).

row.entry: Computer controlled or numerically controlled laser welding and laser cutting machines, and their specially designed components.
Computer controlled or numerically controlled electron beam welding machines, and their specially designed components.

Section.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 11(2)(a) of the Statutory Instruments Act, these Regulations apply before they are published in the Canada Gazette.
For the purpose of paragraph 11(2)(a) of the Statutory Instruments Act, these Regulations apply before they are published in the Canada Gazette.
For the purpose of paragraph 11(2)(a) of the Statutory Instruments Act, these Regulations apply before they are published in the Canada Gazette.
For the purpose of paragraph 11(2)(a) of the Statutory Instruments Act, these Regulations apply before they are published in the Canada Gazette.
For the purposes of paragraph 11(2)(a) of the Statutory Instruments Act, these Regulations apply before they are published in the Canada Gazette.

For the purpose of paragraph 11(2)(a) of the Statutory Instruments Act, these Regulations apply according to their terms before they are published in the Canada Gazette.

For the purpose of paragraph 11(2)(a) of the Statutory Instruments Act, these Regulations apply according to their terms before they are published in the Canada Gazette.
For the purpose of paragraph 11(2)(a) of the Statutory Instruments Act, these Regulations apply according to their terms before they are published in the Canada Gazette.
